name: Fairfield Inn Anaheim Disneyland Resort

reviews.text: My family and I stayed at the Fairfield Inn from March 16-22. We found our room very comfortable and extremely quiet. We were on the fifth floor and we didn't hear any other guests from our room. The beds were heavenly to sleep on. There was even a chair in our room, which made into a bed and was just large enough for our 12 year old to sleep on. The bathroom was small, but adequate. We really like the large shower nozzle. There was also a one cup coffee maker available , which came in handy. The hotel is a short walk away from Disneyland.
reviews.title: Great Time!
Great Stay
reviews.text: We did eat at the Pizza Hut/Seattle Coffee for one meal. The pizza is inexpensive. For less than $7.00 you can get a personal pan pizza, bread sticks and a drink.

reviews.title: One of my favorite hotels in the Disneyland area.
reviews.text: We had a few meals at Mimi's Cafe. Previous writerss to this forum had suggested that it's a good idea to share entree when you go to this restaurant and they were absolutely right. We shared 2 dinner entrees and we had more than enough food for 2 adults, and 2 teenagers. They even served complimentary bread. We spent just over $40.00 on a dinner for 4 people sharing 2 entrees. We also went to Mimi's for breakfast because their 2 egger breakfast comes with juice. We didn't share breakfast and we found that we spent just over $30.00 for 4 of us. They also have a slightly cheaper kids' menu for children 12 and under.

We had a few breakfasts at McDonalds and we found the big breakfast extremely filling, and we spent just over $18.00 for 4 of us. The hotel has a 10% off coupon in the lobby for McDonalds or you can download one online. Go to mousesavers.com for a link to McDonald's coupon and some great ideas on how to save money at Disneyland. We took the food back to our room as we found the McDonalds extremely crowded.
reviews.title: Really liked the Fairfield

reviews.text: If you eat in the park, we found that the Blue Ribbon Bakery on Mainstreet is good for breakfast foods. Go on the Tortilla and Bakery tours in California Adventure because they provide free delicious sample of their food after the tour. Also, share food. Around the Wharf in California Adventure there is bakery that serves enormous salads in bread bowls. We saw many people sharing large entrees around the park and it is definitely a way to save money when eating in Disneyland.
reviews.title: Great stay at the Fairfiled Inn

reviews.text: We stayed at the fairfield Inn Dec 18 2006 - Dec 22nd 2006 in a 2 bed room interconnecting with my parents. we stayed on the 7th floor overlooking the pool and Disneyland. The rooms are huge and totally big enough for the 4 of us , 2A + 2 teenagers 16 and 13. The room has 2 very comfortable queen size beds + 1 single fold out sofa chair if you need another bed. The bathroom had a bath/shower + toilet and the vanity was outside the bathroom and had a coffee machine small bar fridge and huge mirror and hanging space available. Staff were excellent and housekeeping was immaculent. Stand on the verandah outside to watch Disneylands foreworks each night. There is also a coinoperated laundry on each floor as well as on the 3rd floor a pizza hut where you can buy groceries and coffee, sandwiches and salads and a kids play room. You have to eat at Millies restaurant located at the front of the hotel. The chicken pot pie is to die for. Our daughter loved the dinousaur shaped chicken nuggets. Prices are great and the meals are huge. We bought 1 meal and shared between 2 of us. Saved us heaps of money. We walked to Disneyland each day. Only a 10 minute walk and it is directly opposite the hotel. You just have to walk up to the lights located west of the hotel and cross the road into the park. Great location.If we were to visit Disneyland again we would stay no where else but at the Fairfield Inn. We highly recommend this hotel
reviews.title: Loved the Fairfield Inn

reviews.text: Let me start with the same caveat others have mentioned - this is a basic motel-style property. So your expectations should include outside corridors, styrofoam cups, and fairly thin towels.
reviews.title: Very Satisfied

reviews.text: That being said, it is a VERY GOOD basic motel-style property with an excellent location. It is an easy 5 to 10 min walk to Disney. We pushed a loaded baby carriage each day and thought nothing of it. (Last year we stayed at the Disneyland Hotel. I'd say the walk from that property is equally long.)
reviews.title: Wonderful experience

likes.liked: — close to park and cleanliness of the room

reviews.text: Our room was large, modern and clean. The 2 beds were very comfortable. However, don't bank on the 'single sleeper sofa' that comes with the room. It is essentially an oversized chair.
reviews.title: would not stay here again

reviews.text: There's a Pizza Hut on the 3rd Fl as well as a games/arcade room. Coffee and some danish and breakfast foods were available in the morning. We never at there though. Instead we ate at McDonalds and Mimi's Restaraunt (very good). Both are adjacent to the property. The pool was warm, though somewhat small for a property this size. There is also a very small hot tub.
reviews.title: Loved this hotel.

likes.liked: — Value for money, and location, and bedsheets!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This Fairfield Inn property is walking distace to the Main Gate at Disneyland. I used room #610
reviews.title: OK option at a fraction of the Disney price...

reviews.text: Rooms feature the usual motel amenities, including a room fridge. The bed was decently comfortable with too small, too soft pillows. Outside noise was well contained, as the rooms are many yards behind Harbor Blvd.
reviews.title: This is a great place!
Fairfield Inn was Fantastic!!!!!
reviews.text: PROS: Walking distance to the Disneyland Resort. Several family restaurants nearby, with one on property that delivers to rooms. Upper floors offer glimpse into the park itself. Good value for $ when compared to what Disney property hotels may ask for. Room was clean and ready when advertised. Check-in and check-out was efficient and prompt.
CONS: Like all hotels in this area, it faces a major street and so ambience is a bit cheapened. Landscaping was minimal. Tired customers may miss the shuttle convenience other properties offer.
reviews.title: Can't wait to go back!

likes.liked: — It was so clean and close to Disneyland!

reviews.text: CONCLUSION: Good option for a weekend or overnight at the park, but would consider a Disney property hotel or one with more amenities when with a longer stay.
reviews.title: fantastic!!!

likes.liked: — so close to disney, and space
likes.disliked: — we had a room overlooking another hotel and car park.

reviews.text: Hooray! A Marriot hotel only a short jog away from Disneyland!
reviews.title: Great stay ! :)

likes.liked: — The convience, nice beds and the hospitality. :)

reviews.text: I had a phenominal expierence at this hotel! The beds were oh so comfortable and there were pictures of Mickey Mouse on the walls to bring the Disney expierence home. The water pressure of the showers was above average for a hotel.I was happy with the gourmet shower and soap products. There was a Seattles Best Coffee in the hotel, a Pizza Hut and a Gift Shop. Also there were movies in demand in the hotel.
reviews.title: Dream Location!

reviews.text: I loved, loved, loved Disneyland! It wasnt my first time but it was fantastic and even for me, this is the most magical place on earth.
reviews.title: Loved the Location, Beds were HEAVENLY!!!

likes.liked: — Location, AWESOME BEDS, refridgerator, storage space, WONDERFUL POOL!
likes.disliked: — Broken elevator, charged $5.00 for a less then one minute phone call to my hubby back home!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here between the 22nd of March until 27th 2007. After a long flight from Australia (over 14 hours), with two small children in tow, we arrived very tired at the Fairfield at around 8am and received an early check in. The front desk was wonderful. Fast, friendly and fantastic!
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: They had a great room ready (5th floor right at the end on the corner, wonderful view of fireworks) and while we did hear a bit of noise from our neighbours we didn't mind as it is Disneyland, there are going to be kids and my children are certainly not little darlings.
reviews.title: Disappointed that it did not live up to Marriott in its name

This includes Disneyland® Park, Disney's California Adventure® Park and the Downtown Disney® District. With a variety of things to do, all within walking distance, the Anaheim Fairfield Inn by Marriot is the perfect location for your leisure travelers and convention attendees.
